title: 109_s3924
content: AUTHORITY FOR QUALIFYING STATES TO USE SCHIP ALLOTMENTS FOR MEDICAID EXPENDITURES. Amendment to the Social Security Act allows states to use SCHIP allotments for Medicaid expenditures. The amendment removes restrictions on the percentage of allotments for specific fiscal years and imposes additional requirements on qualifying states. Since January 1, 2001, the State cannot reduce income, assets, or resource requirements for Medicaid or SCHIP eligibility. There should be no waiting list or numerical limitation imposed on children's eligibility for medical assistance. The State ensures that all children who apply and qualify receive medical assistance under title XIX or child health assistance. No child should lose coverage or be denied care due to their parents' inability to pay premiums or cost-sharing. The State must implement at least 3 of the following policies and procedures related to coverage of children under title XIX and this title, including the use of a simplified application form for eligibility. The State must implement policies for children's coverage under title XIX and this title, including no asset test, 12-month continuous enrollment, and same verification policies. The State implements redetermination policies for children's medical assistance eligibility, including automatic reassessment using the same verification policies as initial determinations. The State implements redetermination policies for children's medical assistance eligibility, including automatic reassessment at designated healthcare facilities. The amendments made by this section will be effective on October 1, 2006, applying to specified expenditures under the Social Security Act made after that date.
